decks.notes: This deck focuses on controlling the game by countering spells and removing threats with cards like Skred and Cleansing Wildfire. It also utilizes Ephemerate to repeatedly blink creatures like Mulldrifter and Archaeomancer for card advantage and value. The inclusion of Murmuring Mystic provides a win condition by creating bird tokens. The deck also has a few removal spells in Lightning Bolt and Thraben Charm. With a mix of control, card advantage, and value generation, this deck aims to outlast opponents and secure victory through attrition.

This deck focuses on quickly enchanting creatures with powerful auras to create strong attackers that can quickly overwhelm the opponent. By combining cards like Gladecover Scout, Ethereal Armor, and Armadillo Cloak, the deck aims to create large, difficult-to-block threats that can end the game early. The deck also includes cards like Utopia Sprawl and Abundant Growth to help ramp up mana production and ensure the player can cast their auras efficiently. With a mix of evasion, lifelink, and powerful enchantments, this deck aims to win through aggressive creature-based combat.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with a swarm of Elves, utilizing mana ramp and card draw to maintain a strong board presence. The goal is to play multiple Elves each turn, benefitting from their synergistic abilities and creating a powerful army to attack the opponent. The deck includes various ways to generate mana and refill the hand with cards, ensuring that the Elves can continue to grow in numbers and power. It aims to win by outpacing the opponent and dominating the battlefield with a relentless stream of creatures.

The main focus of this deck is to flood the board with low-cost, aggressive creatures like Goblin Bushwhacker and Voldaren Epicure, while utilizing burn spells such as Galvanic Blast and Lightning Bolt to quickly finish off the opponent. With a strong emphasis on dealing damage quickly and efficiently, this Red Deck Wins archetype aims to overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize. The inclusion of cards like Rally at the Hornburg and Reckless Impulse helps to maintain momentum and keep up the pressure throughout the game.

The deck focuses on using artifact creatures and spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggression and resource advantage. By utilizing cards that allow for card draw, artifact recursion, and direct damage, the deck aims to maintain a strong board presence while disrupting the opponent's strategy. With a mix of powerful creatures like Myr Enforcer and efficient removal spells like Galvanic Blast, the deck aims to outpace and outmaneuver the opponent to secure a swift victory.

The main idea of this Mono Black Aggro deck is to swarm the board with low-cost creatures and sacrifice them for value before overwhelming the opponent with damage. The deck focuses on sacrificing creatures to pump up Mortician Beetle, Bloodthrone Vampire, and Shambling Ghast, while using cards like Village Rites and Rite of Consumption to draw cards and deal damage. The deck also includes cards like Infestation Sage and Corrupted Conviction to ensure that the opponent's board stays clear, allowing the aggro strategy to be most effective.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly and aggressively play low-cost creatures and spells to control the board and opponent while maintaining card advantage through efficient card draw and graveyard manipulation. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with tempo plays, counterspells, and evasive creatures like Delver of Secrets and Cryptic Serpent. By using a combination of cheap spells and disruptive abilities, it seeks to control the game and outpace the opponent to secure victory.

This deck focuses on quickly developing a strong board presence using efficient low-cost creatures and ramp spells to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive attacks. It aims to swarm the opponent with creatures like Arbor Elf, Bannerhide Krushok, and Nyxborn Hydra, while using spells like Malevolent Rumble and Ram Through to remove any blockers. The deck also utilizes enchantments like Utopia Sprawl and Wild Growth to accelerate mana production and enable big plays earlier in the game. Overall, this deck aims to win through fast and relentless aggression.

The deck focuses on quickly playing multiple low-cost Elf creatures to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of creatures. By utilizing mana acceleration from cards like Elvish Mystic and Priest of Titania, the deck aims to ramp up quickly and play powerful Elf creatures like Timberwatch Elf and Nyxborn Hydra. The deck also includes card draw spells like Distant Melody and Lead the Stampede to maintain card advantage and ensure a steady stream of creatures to apply constant pressure on the opponent.

The strategy in this deck revolves around using Ephemerate to repeatedly blink powerful creatures like Archaeomancer and Mulldrifter, gaining value each time they enter the battlefield. The deck also includes control elements like Negate and Prohibit to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while generating card advantage with cards like Meeting of Minds. By combining efficient creatures with card draw and disruptive spells, the deck aims to outvalue and outcontrol the opponent in a longer game. The mana base is designed to support the U/W color requirements of the deck.

A Jund Aggro deck that focuses on casting aggressive creatures, sacrificing them for value, and disrupting the opponent's graveyard strategy. The deck utilizes cards like Krark-Clan Shaman and Writhing Chrysalis to put pressure on the opponent, while also using cards like Nihil Spellbomb and Cleansing Wildfire to disrupt any graveyard synergies. With a mix of removal spells and sacrifice outlets, this deck aims to control the game while consistently applying pressure to the opponent. The mana base is designed to support the three-color strategy while also providing options for graveyard hate and card advantage.

This aggressive Jund deck focuses on sacrificing artifacts and creatures to generate value and control the board. By using cards like Writhing Chrysalis and Refurbished Familiar, it aims to overwhelm opponents quickly with high-power threats like Nyxborn Hydra. The deck also includes removal spells like Cast Down and Cleansing Wildfire to deal with opposing threats. With a mix of sacrifice outlets, card draw, and removal, this deck aims to outvalue and outpace opponents in the early game to secure a victory.

This mono black aggro deck focuses on sacrificing creatures for value and creating a fast and aggressive board presence. By utilizing sacrifice effects like Village Rites and Rite of Consumption, along with creatures like Carrion Feeder and Bloodthrone Vampire, the deck can quickly amass an overwhelming army of creatures. With cards like Mortician Beetle and Perigee Beckoner, the deck also benefits from sacrificing creatures by growing in power or drawing cards. This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a relentless onslaught of creatures and sacrifice effects.

The main focus of this Pauper Mono Blue Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent quickly with low-cost creatures like Ninja of the Deep Hours and Spellstutter Sprite, utilizing evasive abilities like flying to deal damage efficiently. The deck also includes control elements like Counterspell and Dispel to disrupt the opponent's game plan. By utilizing a mix of aggressive creatures and disruption spells, the deck aims to maintain a fast-paced tempo while gradually wearing down the opponent's defenses and achieving victory through combat damage.

The focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent quickly with low-cost and efficient creatures and disruptive spells. By utilizing cards that enable card draw and graveyard manipulation, the deck aims to maintain tempo and pressure on the opponent while controlling the board with counterspells. The inclusion of a few finisher spells helps to secure the win once the opponent is unable to keep up with the aggression. The deck's strategy revolves around maintaining a proactive game plan and utilizing card advantage to outpace the opponent.

This Mono Blue Aggro deck focuses on playing cheap, aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets and Cryptic Serpent to quickly apply pressure to the opponent. It also includes a mix of card draw, counterspells, and graveyard recursion to keep the pressure on and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to win the game quickly by overwhelming the opponent with efficient threats and protecting them with counterspells. It is a fast-paced deck that rewards careful resource management and aggressive play.
